Once published, requesters can access your item through the selected categories. You can choose multiple categories that have other items similar to your item. Also, you may be seeing a limited number of categories based on what the template allows you to choose from.

Note: If you specify multiple categories, one of them will be selected as the primary category which appears when viewing the item in a list

result.description: ¬†Specify the reason for which you want this Knowledge Base to be created. The approvers will see this when figuring out if the KB should be created or not.

result.help_text: An arbitrary name that will be displayed in lists and in record detail.  If you will have mulitple LDAP servers then pick names that help you to identify the server being used.
result.name: name

result.help_text:
This is the combination of the server name and server port where your LDAP Server is listening.  Frequently the port is either 389 which is the default port for connectng to LDAP in clear text or 636 which is the standard port for connecting to LDAP via an SSL connection.  You can specify more than one URL address for your LDAP Server.  This does NOT establish multiple directory structures from which you can import data (which is done by creating another LDAP Server entry) but does provide for redundancy when you have multiple LDAP Servers to avoid a single point of failure.  Separate the LDAP URL address with a space character and the system will automatically try each server address in turn until a valid connection can be made.

Example value:  ldap://10.10.10.3:389/
result.name: server_url

result.help_text:
The Starting search directory or RDN (Relative Distinguished Name) where you want Service-now to begin its search for users and/or groups.  No data ABOVE this point will be available for import.  Service-now will only have visibility into the directory from this point specified and below in the LDAP hierarchy.

Example value: DC=service-now,DC=com
result.name: rdn

result.help_text: Specify the database from which you wish to restore. The default is to restore a database from its own backups, but you can specify a different database to be your restore source as well. This allows you to replace one database with a recent backup of another, which is often useful for setting up test systems.
result.name: backup_source

result.sys_name: Restore from this point in time
result.help_text: Indicate which point in time you wish to restore from. Default (if you leave this blank) is to restore from the most recent available backup. However, it is possible to restore from an earlier point in time if necessary.
result.question_text: Restore from this point in time
result.name: restore_pit

result.save_script:
/** This script is executed before the Record is generated
* `current`- GlideRecord produced by Record Producer
* Don't use `current.update()` or `current.insert()` as the record is generated by Record Producer
* Don't use `current.setValue('sys_class_name', 'xxx')` as this will trigger reparent flow and can cause data loss
* Avoid `current.setAbortAction()` and generate a separate record
* Use `producer.var1` to access variables
*/
result.read_script:
var cpUtils = new global.CPIARUtils();
var intentList = cpUtils.getIntentList(current.getValue("sys_id"));
var topicList = cpUtils.getTopicList();

answer = JSON.stringify({
	tableName: "sys_cs_auto_resolution_intent_topic_map",
    query: "ar_configuration="+current.getValue("sys_id"),
	hideHeader: false,
	hidePagination: true,
	viewName: "iar_admin_wizard_view",
	disallowSelectingRecords: false,
	hideQuickEdit:true,
	title: gs.getMessage("Intent to topic map"),
	hideListActions: false,
	hideFilterButton: true,
	hideMenuButton: true,
	hideRefresh: false,
	hideLinks: false,
	fieldValue: current.getValue("sys_id"),
	header: gs.getMessage("Intent to topic map"),
	sub_header: gs.getMessage("Add new Intent to topic map record"),
	intentList: intentList,
	topicList: topicList
});
result.name: intent

result.help_tag: Which topics should be connected to your catalog item?
result.instructions:
After adding the topics of your choice from the available list, the requesters can use the topics you added to find and access the catalog item once the catalog item is published. You can select one or more available topics. The topics you see in the Available Topics list are the ones that you have access to.

The selection of topics doesn’t affect the visibility of the catalog item in the selected catalogs or categories in other portals.

result.save_script:
/** This script is executed before the Record is generated
* `current`- GlideRecord produced by Record Producer
* Don't use `current.update()` or `current.insert()` as the record is generated by Record Producer
* Don't use `current.setValue('sys_class_name', 'xxx')` as this will trigger reparent flow and can cause data loss
* Avoid `current.setAbortAction()` and generate a separate record
* Use `producer.var1` to access variables
*/
result.read_script:
var cpUtils = new global.CPIARUtils();
var listEmailItems = cpUtils.getEmailNotificationList(current.getValue("target_table_name"));
var listSMSItems = cpUtils.getSMSNotificationList(current.getValue("target_table_name"));
var isSMSActive = cpUtils.isSMSActive();

answer = JSON.stringify({
	tableName: "sys_cs_auto_resolution_reminder",
    query: "configuration="+current.getValue("sys_id"),
	hideHeader: false,
	hidePagination: true,
	viewName: "iar_admin_wizard_view",
	disallowSelectingRecords: false,
	hideQuickEdit:true,
	title: gs.getMessage("SLA"),
	hideListActions: false,
	hideFilterButton: true,
	hideMenuButton: true,
	hideRefresh: false,
	hideLinks: false,
	header: gs.getMessage("SLA"),
	sub_header: gs.getMessage("Add new SLA record"),
	fieldName: "configuration",
	fieldValue: current.getValue("sys_id"),
	listEmailItems: listEmailItems,
	listSMSItems: listSMSItems,
	isSMSActive: isSMSActive
});

result.help_tag: Which catalogs would you like your catalog item to live within?
result.instructions:
Once published, requesters can access your item through the selected catalogs. You can select multiple catalogs, but requesters can only view items in the catalogs configured for the specific channel (portal, mobile app or virtual agent) they are in. Also, you may be seeing a limited number of catalogs based on what the template allows you to choose from.

Note: If you remove a previously associated catalog, its categories will also be removed

  • Should not have spaces
  • Should not contain special characters other than underscore (_)
result.name: name

result.help_text: The CPU, or Central Processing Unit, is the "engine" of your computer. Computers with faster CPUs will generally run faster than those with slower CPUs, although, as with an automobile engine there are downsides to high CPU speed, notably cost, heat generation, and power consumption. For our organization, we are recommending the default (2.66GHz) processor for all machines with the exception of the graphics department (recommended 3.73GHz) and the develepment staff (recommended 3.00 GHz).
result.name: cpu_speed
result.description:
Your processor is the brain of your computer. It is also referred to as the microprocessor or CPU. It interprets all the instructions that it receives from various devices and then executes those instructions, such as telling your printer to print. The faster the processor, generally the faster the computer will usually be able to perform those instructions and tasks.

To help you choose click here

result.name: memory
result.description:
• Random Access Memory (RAM) is the workhorse behind the performance of your computer. RAM temporarily stores information from your operating system, applications, and data in current use. This gives your processor easy access to the critical information that makes your programs run.
  • The amount of RAM you have determines how many programs can be executed at one time and how much data can be readily available to a program. It also helps determine how quickly your applications perform and how many applications you can easily toggle between at one time.

To help you choose, click here

result.name: hard_drive
result.description: This is the primary storage drive for your computer. To help you decide, click here
